etymologies: early 19th century: from the modern Latin use as an epithet of Latin lupulus (as in Humulus lupulus), a plant mentioned by Pliny and perhaps denoting ‘wild hops’, + -in

definitions: a bitter yellowish powder found on glandular hairs beneath the scales of the flowers of the female hop plant.
shortDefinitions: bitter yellowish powder found on glandular hairs beneath scales of flowers
